answers.answer: Metformin is used with proper diet and exercise to control high blood sugar in people diagnosed with type 2 diabetes. Like all medication it may not always work with every individual.Did you consult with your doctor;• That you were losing weight?• Had two episodes of low glucose?• Stopping Metformin?• Resuming Metformin?• Pros/cons of Metformin with you?• Severe Heartburn?Stopping and resuming medication on your own w/o consulting your doctor is not wise. Complications may arise.Are you checking your glucose levels with a home test meter on a regular basis? Your log - dates/time/reading - should be presented to your doctor for analysis. It would help your doctor too if you indicated your weight at time of test.Something better than Metformin? Yes, one is a healthy lifestyle by carefully monitoring your nutrition along with moderate exercise and keeping your weight at normal levels. Injectable insulin would be your final recourse. I think its time you spoke directly with your doctor.By the way, congrats on the weight loss.

question: I was wondering if Metformin is really any good? I was diagnosed with type 2 Diabetes last summer, was prescribed Metformin,500mg. twice a day it wasn't reducuing my levels immediately , so it was uped to 3x's a day then I began to lose weight, it lowered my blood sugar in about 3 months after losing 30 lbs. Then I had 2 seperate episodes of low blood sugar, I crashed hard and fast, I never experienced that before...scared the **** outta me.  I back stepped and stopped taking it which now I am back to square one. Anyone have a similar experience? And is there anthing better that works than Metformin, I also, began taking it agin and have sever heartburn. Anyone HELP!!!!
title: Metformin does it really work?
